alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Newton; Pope (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 15 at 1:25PM CDT until May 15 at 4:25PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... North Central Pope County in central Arkansas... Newton County in north central Arkansas... Northeastern Johnson County in western Arkansas... * Until 425 PM CDT. * At 125 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Jasper, Walnut, Upper Buffalo Wilderness Area, Lost Valley State Park, Rosetta, Erbie, Devils Knob, Dillen, Pruitt, Bertha, Wayton, Swain, Nail, Parthenon, Low Gap, Mossville, Crossroad, Deer, Boxley and Mt Sherman. This includes the following streams and drainages... Hurricane Creek, North Fork Illinois Bayou, West Fork Big Piney Creek, Buffalo River, Left Hand Prong, Terrapin Branch, Nuckles Creek, Dry Creek, Running Creek, Carlton Branch, Cove Branch, Hoskin Creek, Home Creek, Osage Creek, Cedar Creek, Buck Branch, Lewis Prong, Flatrock Creek, West Fork Shop Creek, Greasy Creek, Indian Creek, Mulberry River, Haw Creek, East Fork Shop Creek, Boen Gulf Branch, Cove Creek, Long Branch, Stepp Creek, East Fork Little Buffalo River, Cow Creek, Richland Creek, Bear Creek, Middle Cow Creek, Big Creek, Dog Branch, Big Piney Creek, Henson Creek, Left Fork Big Creek, Little Buffalo River, Sulphur Creek, Smith Creek, Bradley Branch, Walnut Creek, Beech Creek, Curtis Creek, Cecil Creek, Boulder Creek, Moore Creek, Sneeds Creek, Dismal Creek, Crooked Creek, Micks Branch, Gunter Branch, Rock Creek, Beckham Creek, Thomas Creek, Little Piney Creek and Shop Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
